main event: A bright-white colored object was observed moving directly overhead in Scarsdale, New York on January 6, 1967.
interesting points: The object was round with a front portion and a tail section, and had three or four lights on the side and a pulsating light at the front.
A small aircraft was noted directly beneath the object, moving in a westerly direction.
The object moved in a parabolic arc until sighting, then straight up until it was the size of a dime, then downward to the same area, then straight up until it disappeared.
The sighting lasted a maximum of three minutes, possibly as little as two minutes.
Local radar was unable to detect the object, and the report suggests it could have been some kind of early jet or experimental aircraft.
sighted object: A bright-white colored, round object with a front portion, tail section, and lights
